parts:
text: "<question>Analyze `sample-weather.csv`.

Return a JSON object with keys:
- `average_temp_c`: number
- `max_precip_date`: string
- `min_temp_c`: number
- `temp_precip_correlation`: number
- `average_precip_mm`: number
- `temp_line_chart`: base64 PNG string under 100kB
- `precip_histogram`: base64 PNG string under 100kB

Answer:
1. What is the average temperature in Celsius?
2. On which date was precipitation highest?
3. What is the minimum temperature recorded?
4. What is the correlation between temperature and precipitation?
5. What is the average precipitation in millimeters?
6. Plot temperature over time as a line chart with a red line. Encode as base64 PNG.
7. Plot precipitation as a histogram with orange bars. Encode as base64 PNG.
</question>"

text: "{\"code\": \"import pandas as pd\\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\\nimport base64\\nimport json\\n\\n# Load the dataframe.\\ndf = pd.read_csv(\'sample-weather.csv\')\\n\\n# Initial data exploration\\ncolumns = df.columns.tolist()\\nhead = df.head().to_string()\\nwith open(\'metadata.txt\', \'w\') as f:\\n    f.write(\'Columns:\\\\n\' + str(columns) + \'\\\\n\\\\nHead:\\\\n\' + head)\\n\\n# 1. Average temperature\\navg_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].mean()\\n\\n# 2. Date of highest precipitation\\nmax_precip_date = df.loc[df[\'precipitation_mm\'].idxmax(), \'date\']\\n\\n# 3. Minimum temperature\\nmin_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].min()\\n\\n# 4. Correlation\\ncorrelation = df[\'temperature_c\'].corr(df[\'precipitation_mm\'])\\n\\n# 5. Average precipitation\\navg_precip = df[\'precipitation_mm\'].mean()\\n\\n# 6. Temperature line chart\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.plot(df[\'date\'], df[\'temperature_c\'], color=\'red\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Date\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Temperature (°C)\')\\nplt.title(\'Temperature over Time\')\\nplt.xticks(rotation=45)\\nplt.tight_layout()\\ntemp_chart = plt.gcf()\\ntemp_chart.canvas.draw()\\ntemp_image = temp_chart.canvas.tostring_rgb()\\ntemp_base64 = base64.b64encode(temp_image).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n\\n# 7. Precipitation histogram\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.hist(df[\'precipitation_mm\'], color=\'orange\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Precipitation (mm)\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Frequency\')\\nplt.title(\'Precipitation Distribution\')\\nplt.tight_layout()\\nprecip_chart = plt.gcf()\\nprecip_chart.canvas.draw()\\nprecip_image = precip_chart.canvas.tostring_rgb()\\nprecip_base64 = base64.b64encode(precip_image).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n\\n# Create the JSON object\\nresult = {\\n    \\\"average_temp_c\\\": avg_temp,\\n    \\\"max_precip_date\\\": max_precip_date,\\n    \\\"min_temp_c\\\": min_temp,\\n    \\\"temp_precip_correlation\\\": correlation,\\n    \\\"average_precip_mm\\\": avg_precip,\\n    \\\"temp_line_chart\\\": temp_base64,\\n    \\\"precip_histogram\\\": precip_base64\\n}\\n\\n# Write the JSON object to result.json\\nwith open(\'result.json\', \'w\') as f:\\n    json.dump(result, f)\\n\", \"libraries\": [\"pandas\", \"matplotlib\", \"base64\"], \"run_this\": 1}"

Average temperature\\navg_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].mean()\\n\\n# 2. Date of highest precipitation\\nmax_precip_date = df.loc[df[\'precip_mm\'].idxmax(), \'date\']\\n\\n# 3. Minimum temperature\\nmin_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].min()\\n\\n# 4. Correlation\\ncorrelation = df[\'temperature_c\'].corr(df[\'precip_mm\'])\\n\\n# 5. Average precipitation\\navg_precip = df[\'precip_mm\'].mean()\\n\\n# 6. Temperature line chart\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.plot(df[\'date\'], df[\'temperature_c\'], color=\'red\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Date\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Temperature (°C)\')\\nplt.title(\'Temperature over Time\')\\nplt.xticks(rotation=45)\\nplt.tight_layout()\\ntemp_chart = plt.gcf()\\ntemp_chart.canvas.draw()\\ntemp_image = temp_chart.canvas.tostring_rgb()\\ntemp_base64 = base64.b64encode(temp_image).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n\\n\\n# 7. Precipitation histogram\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.hist(df[\'precip_mm\'], color=\'orange\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Precipitation (mm)\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Frequency\')\\nplt.title(\'Precipitation Distribution\')\\nplt.tight_layout()\\nprecip_chart = plt.gcf()\\nprecip_chart.canvas.draw()\\nprecip_image = precip_chart.canvas.tostring_rgb()\\nprecip_base64 = base64.b64encode(precip_image).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n\\n# Create the JSON object\\nresult = {\\n    \\\"average_temp_c\\\": avg_temp,\\n    \\\"max_precip_date\\\": max_precip_date,\\n    \\\"min_temp_c\\\": min_temp,\\n    \\\"temp_precip_correlation\\\": correlation,\\n    \\\"average_precip_mm\\\": avg_precip,\\n    \\\"temp_line_chart\\\": temp_base64,\\n    \\\"precip_histogram\\\": precip_base64\\n}\\n\\n# Write the JSON object to result.json\\nwith open(\'result.json\', \'w\') as f:\\n    json.dump(result, f)\\n\", \"libraries\": [\"pandas\", \"matplotlib\", \"base64\"], \"run_this\": 1}"

Did you mean: \'tostring_argb\'?</error_snippet>\nSolve this error."

text: "{\"code\": \"import pandas as pd\\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\\nimport base64\\nimport json\\nimport io\\n\\n# Load the dataframe.\\ndf = pd.read_csv(\'sample-weather.csv\')\\n\\n# Initial data exploration\\ncolumns = df.columns.tolist()\\nhead = df.head().to_string()\\nwith open(\'metadata.txt\', \'w\') as f:\\n    f.write(\'Columns:\\\\n\' + str(columns) + \'\\\\n\\\\nHead:\\\\n\' + head)\\n\\n# 1. Average temperature\\navg_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].mean()\\n\\n# 2. Date of highest precipitation\\nmax_precip_date = df.loc[df[\'precip_mm\'].idxmax(), \'date\']\\n\\n# 3. Minimum temperature\\nmin_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].min()\\n\\n# 4. Correlation\\ncorrelation = df[\'temperature_c\'].corr(df[\'precip_mm\'])\\n\\n# 5. Average precipitation\\navg_precip = df[\'precip_mm\'].mean()\\n\\n# 6. Temperature line chart\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.plot(df[\'date\'], df[\'temperature_c\'], color=\'red\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Date\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Temperature (°C)\')\\nplt.title(\'Temperature over Time\')\\nplt.xticks(rotation=45)\\nplt.tight_layout()\\ntemp_chart = plt.gcf()\\ntemp_chart.canvas.draw()\\nimg_data = io.BytesIO()\\ntemp_chart.savefig(img_data, format=\'png\')\\nimg_data.seek(0)\\ntemp_base64 = base64.b64encode(img_data.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n\\n\\n# 7. Precipitation histogram\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.hist(df[\'precip_mm\'], color=\'orange\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Precipitation (mm)\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Frequency\')\\nplt.title(\'Precipitation Distribution\')\\nplt.tight_layout()\\nprecip_chart = plt.gcf()\\nprecip_chart.canvas.draw()\\nimg_data = io.BytesIO()\\nprecip_chart.savefig(img_data, format=\'png\')\\nimg_data.seek(0)\\nprecip_base64 = base64.b64encode(img_data.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n# Create the JSON object\\nresult = {\\n    \\\"average_temp_c\\\": avg_temp,\\n    \\\"max_precip_date\\\": max_precip_date,\\n    \\\"min_temp_c\\\": min_temp,\\n    \\\"temp_precip_correlation\\\": correlation,\\n    \\\"average_precip_mm\\\": avg_precip,\\n    \\\"temp_line_chart\\\": temp_base64,\\n    \\\"precip_histogram\\\": precip_base64\\n}\\n\\n# Write the JSON object to result.json\\nwith open(\'result.json\', \'w\') as f:\\n    json.dump(result, f)\", \"libraries\": [\"pandas\", \"matplotlib\", \"base64\", \"io\"], \"run_this\": 1}"

text: "{\"code\": \"import pandas as pd\\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\\nimport base64\\nimport json\\nimport io\\n\\n# Load the dataframe.\\ndf = pd.read_csv(\'sample-weather.csv\')\\n\\n# Initial data exploration\\ncolumns = df.columns.tolist()\\nhead = df.head().to_string()\\nwith open(\'metadata.txt\', \'w\') as f:\\n    f.write(\'Columns:\\\\n\' + str(columns) + \'\\\\n\\\\nHead:\\\\n\' + head)\\n\\n# 1. Average temperature\\navg_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].mean()\\n\\n# 2. Date of highest precipitation\\nmax_precip_date = df.loc[df[\'precip_mm\'].idxmax(), \'date\']\\n\\n# 3. Minimum temperature\\nmin_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].min()\\n\\n# 4. Correlation\\ncorrelation = df[\'temperature_c\'].corr(df[\'precip_mm\'])\\n\\n# 5. Average precipitation\\navg_precip = df[\'precip_mm\'].mean()\\n\\n# 6. Temperature line chart\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.plot(df[\'date\'], df[\'temperature_c\'], color=\'red\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Date\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Temperature (°C)\')\\nplt.title(\'Temperature over Time\')\\nplt.xticks(rotation=45)\\nplt.tight_layout()\\ntemp_buf = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(temp_buf, format=\'png\')\\ntemp_base64 = base64.b64encode(temp_buf.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\nplt.close()\\n\\n# 7. Precipitation histogram\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.hist(df[\'precip_mm\'], color=\'orange\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Precipitation (mm)\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Frequency\')\\nplt.title(\'Precipitation Distribution\')\\nplt.tight_layout()\\nprecip_buf = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(precip_buf, format=\'png\')\\nprecip_base64 = base64.b64encode(precip_buf.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\nplt.close()\\n\\n# Create the JSON object\\nresult = {\\n    \\\"average_temp_c\\\": avg_temp,\\n    \\\"max_precip_date\\\": max_precip_date,\\n    \\\"min_temp_c\\\": min_temp,\\n    \\\"temp_precip_correlation\\\": correlation,\\n    \\\"average_precip_mm\\\": avg_precip,\\n    \\\"temp_line_chart\\\": temp_base64,\\n    \\\"precip_histogram\\\": precip_base64\\n}\\n\\n# Write the JSON object to result.json\\nwith open(\'result.json\', \'w\') as f:\\n    json.dump(result, f)\", \"libraries\": [\"pandas\", \"matplotlib\", \"base64\", \"io\"], \"run_this\": 1}"

text: "{\"code\": \"import pandas as pd\\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\\nimport base64\\nimport json\\nimport io\\n\\n# Load the dataframe.\\ndf = pd.read_csv(\'sample-weather.csv\')\\n\\n# Initial data exploration\\ncolumns = df.columns.tolist()\\nhead = df.head().to_string()\\nwith open(\'metadata.txt\', \'w\') as f:\\n    f.write(\'Columns:\\\\n\' + str(columns) + \'\\\\n\\\\nHead:\\\\n\' + head)\\n\\n# 1. Average temperature\\navg_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].mean()\\n\\n# 2. Date of highest precipitation\\nmax_precip_date = df.loc[df[\'precip_mm\'].idxmax(), \'date\']\\n\\n# 3. Minimum temperature\\nmin_temp = df[\'temperature_c\'].min()\\n\\n# 4. Correlation\\ncorrelation = df[\'temperature_c\'].corr(df[\'precip_mm\'])\\n\\n# 5. Average precipitation\\navg_precip = df[\'precip_mm\'].mean()\\n\\n# 6. Temperature line chart\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.plot(df[\'date\'], df[\'temperature_c\'], color=\'red\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Date\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Temperature (°C)\')\\nplt.title(\'Temperature over Time\')\\nplt.xticks(rotation=45)\\nplt.tight_layout()\\ntemp_buf = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(temp_buf, format=\'png\')\\ntemp_base64 = base64.b64encode(temp_buf.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\nplt.close()\\n\\n# 7. Precipitation histogram\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.hist(df[\'precip_mm\'], color=\'orange\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Precipitation (mm)\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Frequency\')\\nplt.title(\'Precipitation Distribution\')\\nplt.tight_layout()\\nprecip_buf = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(precip_buf, format=\'png\')\\nprecip_base64 = base64.b64encode(precip_buf.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\nplt.close()\\n\\n# Create the JSON object\\nresult = {\\n    \\\"average_temp_c\\\": avg_temp,\\n    \\\"max_precip_date\\\": str(max_precip_date),\\n    \\\"min_temp_c\\\": min_temp,\\n    \\\"temp_precip_correlation\\\": correlation,\\n    \\\"average_precip_mm\\\": avg_precip,\\n    \\\"temp_line_chart\\\": temp_base64,\\n    \\\"precip_histogram\\\": precip_base64\\n}\\n\\n# Write the JSON object to result.json\\nwith open(\'result.json\', \'w\') as f:\\n    json.dump(result, f)\", \"libraries\": [\"pandas\", \"matplotlib\", \"base64\", \"io\"], \"run_this\": 1}"
